infodynamics.utils

Class EuclideanUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.utils.EuclideanUtils

  • public class EuclideanUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    A set of utilities for manipulating vectors in Euclidean space.
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

        public EuclideanUtils(int normToUse)
        Construct a EuclideanUtils object, to take norms of the given type
        Parameters:
        normToUse - norm type, one of NORM_EUCLIDEAN, NORM_EUCLIDEAN_NORMALISED, NORM_MAX_NORM or NORM_MAX_NORM

        Parameters:

      • computeMinEuclideanDistances

      • computeMinEuclideanDistancesNaive

        public static double[] computeMinEuclideanDistancesNaive(double[][] observations)
        Naive method for computing minimum distance - slower but needs less memory. Made public for debugging only. O(d.n^2) speed
        Parameters:
        observations -
        Returns:

      • computeMinEuclideanDistancesFast

        public static double[] computeMinEuclideanDistancesFast(double[][] observations)
        Return the minimum Euclidean distance from each point to any other observation. Computes this faster than using naive computation. Exposed as a public method for debugging purposes only.
        Parameters:
        observations -
        Returns:

      • computeNorms

        public double[][] computeNorms(double[][] mvTimeSeries1,
                      double[][] mvTimeSeries2,
                      int t)
        Compute the x and y configured norms of all other points from the data points at time step t. Puts norms of t from itself as infinity, which is useful when counting the number of points closer than epsilon say.
        Parameters:
        mvTimeSeries1 -
        mvTimeSeries2 -
        Returns:

      • computeNorms

        public double[][] computeNorms(double[][] mvTimeSeries1,
                      double[][] mvTimeSeries2,
                      double[][] mvTimeSeries3,
                      int t)
        Compute the x, y and z norms of all other points from the data points at time step t. Puts norms of t from itself as infinity, which is useful when counting the number of points closer than epsilon say.
        Parameters:
        mvTimeSeries1 -
        mvTimeSeries2 -
        mvTimeSeries3 -
        Returns:

      • computeNorms

        public static double[][] computeNorms(double[][] mvTimeSeries,
                      int t)
        Compute the norms for each marginal variable for all other points from the data points at time step t. Puts norms of t from itself as infinity, which is useful when counting the number of points closer than epsilon say.
        Parameters:
        mvTimeSeries -
        Returns:
